Today in market history, 1906: the Dow peaked at 103. The Panic of 1907 would send it crashing down by 48.5%.

On this day in market history, 1927:   The Dow Jones Industrial Average first hits 190. Corporations used low interest rates to refinance and buy back higher yielding securities.    The Dow will ultimately climb to 381 by 1929 and crash to 41 in 1932.

Today in market history, 2015:  Google incorporates a new holding company called Alphabet. Modeled after Berkshire Hathaway, it will allow for each unit to be run by its own CEO. Voting power will be concentrated among its founders.

Today in market history, 1990:   The cyclical bear market of 1990 - the Dow Jones peaks and will fall 22% over the next three months.   It bottoms in October and is up 50% within three years. This was the midpoint of the 1982-2000 secular bull market.

Today in market history, 1997:  The Dow Jones Industrial Average crosses 8,000 for the first time ever.   "I expect we will cross 8000, and it will be like going from Pennsylvania to Ohio. It will be a big deal for 35 seconds, but then it’s 'How far to Indiana?'” - Laszlo Birinyi
Today in market history, 1994:   Amazon is founded in Bellevue, Washington. It will go public three years later, raising $54 million.

Today in market history, 1997:  Amazon comes public at $18 per share with $15 million in annual revenue and $5.75 million in losses.    An investment of $100 on that day would be worth over $101,000 today.
